item.title: Uncollected rubbish attracting wildlife / hazard to domestic animals, 16th February
item.description:
This rubbish has been left for over a week now with the usual bin lorry collections refusing to take it. The rubbish has now been ripped open by wildlife and the contents strewn across the public footpath and it is encouraging foxes, rsts and gulls. There is also a health concern for domestic pets as the discarded food contents is accessible to all. This is a common occurrence at this location and needs to be rectified as soon as possible.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Tunnel Avenue, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tactile paving broken, 16th February
item.description:
Tactile paving broken on the northern side of the crossing on Felixstowe Road. This has become a prolonged issue as there are numermous vehicles driving in and out of Tilston Bright Square.

item.title: Continuous fly tipping becoming more frequent with no resolution, 16th February
item.description:
Further to ref: 8914360, 8880708, 8849897, 8730739, 8676867, and 8682206, the issue of constant fly tipping, with black rubbish bags and other rubbish being left out in the communal pathway, continues unresolved week after week. This latest instance occurred on the evening of 15 Feb or very early in the morning of 16 Feb. Attention to this matter to stop it from happening continuously, week after week, is urgently needed. In fact the problem has worsened with fly tipping in this area having now occurred 3 times in the last week.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lucey Way, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Extremely large pothole - NOT FIXED!!!, 16th February
item.description:
The pothole has been "patched" various times over the years and never fully repaired. It causes mass issues to cars suspension and steering alignments. Bikes and mopeds swerve to avoid it as hitting it will make them flip, you could easily stand in it for the depth and width of it. Being a main bus/lorry route this is destroying the road and will subsidise soon enough if not delt with. This has been an issue for months, it keeps getting worse.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 136, Mayplace Road East, Barnehurst, Bexleyheath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
